data.title: The editor cannot be used while compiling
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit an F# project for a long time using the `vscodevim` plugin
2. Start a compilation
3. While compiling, switch to VSCode
4. The edit-mode doesn't work.


Steps to Reproduce 2:

1. Edit an F# project for a long time using the `vscodevim` plugin
2. Press CMD+S, to save
3. Try to press `i` for insert; the cursor doesn't change.

Can I enable tracing and timing information to be output to the developer console, somehow? This is really disruptive for my flow. ;)

data.title: Undo and redo keys are swapped in linux, keyboard settings: HU
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.10-200.fc25.x86_64
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-database|bajdzis|1.2.0|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.1|
|vue|jcbuisson|0.1.5|
|vuehelper|oysun|0.1.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|;

I think, that undo (Ctrl+Z) and redo (Ctrl+Y) keys are swapped. In my Fedora operating system the keyboard setting is HU. It is my keyboard:
1st line:       qwertzuiopőú
2nd line:      asdfghjkléáű
3rd line:       íyxcvbnm
The Z and Y keys are swapped in my keyboard because of HU settings.
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. delete some character in the editor
2. press Ctrl+Z : nothing is happened
3. press Ctrl+Y : deleted characters are restored
4. expected result: resotre characters, when Ctrl+Z pressed

data.title: The keyboard shortcuts for Add Cursor Below/Above (Ctrl + Alt + DownArrow/UpArrow) do not work anymore.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.3|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.16|
|matlab|Gimly81|0.5.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|;


---
The keyboard shortcuts for Add Cursor Below/Above (Ctrl + Alt + DownArrow/UpArrow) do not work anymore. The shortcuts are correctly binded in Keyboard Shortcuts and remapping them there does not allow for the down or up arrow to be entered after Ctrl + Alt. The arrows function by themselves and selecting "Add Cursor Below" in the Selection menu works.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start with the cursor anywhere with at least one line below.
2. Hold Ctrl. then Alt, then DownArrow.
3. If a second cursor does not appear, the issue has been reproduced.
4. Additionally, in Keyboard Shortcuts find Add Cursor Above (should be the first item)
5. Click the edit pencil.
6. Hold Ctrl, hold Alt, press UpArrow.
7. If the UpArrow does not display, the issue has been reproduced.

data.title: feature request: add a TM_FILENAME_BASE and TM_FILENAME_EXT or similar variables for snippets
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:

```sh
$ code --version
1.11.2
6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
```

- OS Version:

```sh
$ sw_vers
ProductName:	Mac OS X
ProductVersion:	10.12.4
BuildVersion:	16E195
```

Feature Request:

Currently, the TM_FILENAME includes the extension and their is no way to strip this within a snippet. For snippets such as those that insert a class definition in languages where the file name is conventionally relevant to the class / module / function within, it would be great to get access to the filename with the extension stripped.

I can't think of a scenario with the filename extension is relevant, honestly, but if you're going to split the string on the first occurrence of a `.`, you might as well join everything to the right of that dot and have a var for that as well. :)

data.title: Expose WebRTC API to extensions
data.body:
It would be great if VSCode could expose the WebRTC API from it's render process to extensions.

Currently there's no way to use WebRTC in extensions barring including a [wrtc](https://github.com/js-platform/node-webrtc) binary for *every* operating system (which is obviously not an option) or spawning a whole new electron process.

Ideally, extensions could have full access to the render process like other editors allow, but I know this has been brought up several times before.

This would unlock an enormous number of awesome P2P applications.

data.title: Improve TS Extension Logic for Handling Configuration Changes
Pass Source and Level For TS/JS Diagnostics
data.body:
**Bug**
All TS/JS diagnostics are currently reported as errors. We also cannot pass a custom source to identify them as coming from a tsserver plugin  such as tslint

**Fix**
Add support for the new fields added in TS2.3.1 that provide this information


Fixes #24907

data.title: remove heuristic for calculating evaluation expression for variable access
data.body:
Remove heuristic for calculating evaluation expression for variable access and use the "evaluateName" attribute instead.
If "evaluateName" is falsy, all actions relying on it should not be available (e.g. "Add to watch").

data.title: Allow notion of NoSideEffects during watch window evaluation for during step

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Insiders 1.12.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creators Update

Steps to Reproduce:
(tested this with C# code)
1. create a small app with a field that has some notion of state. Create a method that changes this state. 
2. set a break point early on and add the call to the method in the watch window.

Expected: 
On step, the expression in the watch window won't evaluate if it causes state change (no side effects evaluation).

Actual: 
It evaluates the expression in every step and callstack line change causing state changes.

data.title: Lazily Fetch Supported TypeScript Code Actions
data.body:
Delay fetching the supported code actions for TS/JS until we actually need them.

This will allow TSServer plugins time to register their supported code actions

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search project for a string that matches (eg "class")

5. Open additional file and reapply search.  Note results include newly opened file

data.title: Suggestion: Don't center justify 'label' call stack frames
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

On the C# extension we have stack frames that should really have the `presentationHint` of `label`. So I went to add this, but I found the results somewhat visually jarring. I conducted a rather unscientific survey by asking my coworkers what they thought of it, and everyone seemed to have a similar reaction. So I am opening this bug as a suggestion to stop center-justifying 'label' frames.

Here is a screen capture of what this looks like:

![callstackwithlabelframes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11078489/25296926/7b9c8acc-269f-11e7-95be-99ac021f548e.png)

data.title: Declare watching tasks without endsPattern

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Reference https://github.com/ionide/ionide-vscode-fsharp/issues/412

I'm trying to use Webpack with a custom loader ([fable-loader](http://fable.io/)) together with Visual Studio Code tasks so the custom loader can highlight warnings and errors directly in the IDE. This is already working fine for single compilations, but not so well in [watch compilations](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_background-watching-tasks). The reason is VS Code task configuration requires both `beginsPattern` and `endsPattern` of a watch compilation in the output. However I cannot get Webpack to output a message at the end of a watch compilation **after all warnings and errors** have been displayed. (I've asked in Webpack forum and [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43497359/output-message-at-the-end-of-webpack-watch-compilation-after-warnings-and-error) but didn't get a reply.)

Would it be possible to make the `endsPattern` optional? In this case, every time the `beginsPattern` occurs, VS Code would just reset all errors and warnings previously reported by the task an start over. That would be perfect for my use case.

Thanks a lot for your support and for the great tool!

data.title: Support development extension installations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.11.2

I have the [vshaxe](https://github.com/vshaxe/vshaxe) extension cloned into `.vscode/extensions/vshaxe`, which is the usual workflow for working on extensions as far as I can tell. I didn't have the most recent commit pulled yet, so the version in my local `package.json` was behind the officially relased one. This leads to VSCode actually asking me to update the extension (which doesn't make a lot of sense for an extension installed from source):

![](http://i.imgur.com/MC22OEx.png)

When you do this, VSCode installs the extension as it usually would, into a `nadako.vshaxe-1.5.1` folder, which then actually _overrides_ the development installation of the extension on the next restart. This alone wouldn't be a huge issue, but I had `"extensions.autoUpdate": true` in my settings, so **this happened without me realizing it**.

It seems that there's an assumption here somewhere that a development installation of an extension will always have a version that's >= the version of the latest release. However, there are a number of reasons why this might not be the case:

- As an extension developer, you might not have pulled the most recent commit(s) yet.
- As an extension developler, you might want to check out out older commits to `git bisect` something.
- As an extension user, you might want to install an extension from source to be able to roll back to an earlier version of it because the most recent version broke something (I don't think there's currently another way to install older versions of extensions? Related: #25142).

data.title: Markdown preview does not update when file is untitled/unsaved

1. Open a new file
2. Paste some Markdown into it
3. Ctrl+P > Markdown: Open Preview to the Side
4. Update markdown, no updates in side preview
5. Repeat but the same but save the file between after step 2, preview updates automatically

data.title: scss warning message when using 'display: inline-block' and float seems incorrect

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macos 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

in sass file:
```
.elems {
  display: inline-block;
  float: left;
}
```
float property gets a squiggly line and the warning states:

> Property is ignored due to the display. With 'display: inline-block', float properties have no effect.

I think this is backwards. Looking at computed properties (chrome) and researching, it seems the exact opposite is true. The display property is ignored and computed as block.

Some references:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/5854523/2124351
http://stackoverflow.com/a/27511744/2124351
